intro: Actephila discoidea, commonly known as the white-flowered actephila, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Actephila discoidea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
